%text \textbf{Intuition } Let $A$ run twice as fast as $B$ and $B$ run 3 times as fast as $C$. Then how fast does $A$ run compared to $C$? The answer is simply $6 (= 2\times 3)$ The idea behind Chain Rule is the same If $f(x)$ be a composite function, that is, $\quad f(x) = g\left[ h(x) \right] = (g\circ h)(x)$, then \[ \qquad \frac{d}{dx} f(x) = \frac{d}{d h(x)}g(x)\times \frac{d}{dx} h(x) \] For example, if $f(x) = \sin \left( x^2\right)$ , then % \begin{align}
\frac{d}{dx} f(x) &= \frac{d}{d x^2} \sin \left(x^2 \right)\times \frac{d}{dx} x^2 \\ &= \cos \left(x^2 \right)\cdot 2x \end{align} %text %
